post.summary:
Clears all the EMS caches currently active in the application, which can be useful if underlying the data 
            or security for one or more related EMS systems has changed recently and you want these changes to take 
            effect immediately.

401.description: You do not have access to the requested resource.

post.summary: Informs the website that security has been modified on an EMS system and requests a refresh from Active Directory.
post.description:
Typically this is called when there have
            been modifications to user or group membership in groups in Active Dirctory. In desktop applications, when someone
            has their group membership changed, that user can lock and unlock the machine, which recreates the user token 
            representing the rights for that user. In the case of a web server, there is no way to manually refresh the cached
            user rights short of stopping and starting the application pool. 
            Instead, call this method to force the web server to refresh access rights based on group membership changes.

401.description: You do not have access to the requested resource.

post.summary: Queries offsets and values in time-series data for a specified flight and analytic.
post.description:
This can be used to query for multiple analytics at the same time by providing more than one analytic ID in the query. Keep in mind that querying for many analytics might cause your request to take a longer period of time to complete.

Below are some guidelines to consider when using this API.

  • Use the "size" option to return a specified amount of interpolated samples.
  • Not specifying a "size" returns all data samples, but you can also use a range of "start" and "end" values to limit the amount of data returned. You can't use this option with the "unsampledDataMode" option.
  • Use the "offsets" option to return data for only a specified set of samples. If an analytic isn't sampled at the offset, its interpolated value is returned. You can't use this option with the "unsampledDataMode" option.
  • Use the "offsetType" option to return values only at sampled locations using the "sampledValues" option or at a specific sampling rate using the "samplingRate" option. Since these options are more complex and can leave sample locations with no value (i.e. the analytic isn't sampled at that location) or DNE values where the sample "does not exist" you can use the "offsetType" in conjunction with the "unsampledDataMode", the "unsampledValue", and/or the "doesNotExistValue" options. These are explained in greater detail below.
  • If you use the "unsampledDataMode" option with "offsetType" you can set how unsampled data is treated with one of the following options:
    • "leaveBlank": Leaves any unsampled data locations as blank values. This is the default.
    • "uniquePreviousSample": Leave values blank except when there is a previous valid sampled value that was skipped over due to the sampling rate. This can be used to circumvent the issue of possibly returning all blank values when the configured sampling rate does not coincide with the analytic's sampling rate.
    • "stairStep": Any unsampled values are filled with the last known sampled value.
    • "linearInterpolation": This performs a linear interpolation on the data to calculate a value for unsampled locations.
    • "parameterDefault": Some analytics define their own default for how to treat unsampled data. This option uses that default setting.
  • Use the "unsampledValue" to provide your own value to be used for unsampled values.
  • Use the "doesNotExistValue" to provide your own value for values that are DNE.
  • If an analytic returns a constant value, consider querying for an individual offset to reduce the amount of data returned.

parameters.name: emsSystemId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the system containing the EMS data.

parameters.name: flightId
parameters.description: The integer ID of the flight record for which to query data.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The information used to construct a query for which results are returned.

400.description: If the specified query structure is invalid or incorrectly configured.

401.description: You do not have access to the requested resource.

post.summary: Returns the analytic metadata for a flight.
post.description:
There are two special values always returned by the metadata call.

  • Shape : [Single, Multiple, Unknown] : describes whether the result will be a single value or an array of values.
  • DataType : [Real, Integer, String, Boolean, DateTime, Unknown] : describes the type of data returned.
The list of other properties returned are specific to each analytic but may include:
  • Basic\Comments
  • Basic\Description
  • Information\Comments
  • Information\Description
  • Information\UID
  • Parameter\Abbreviation
  • Parameter\Constant
  • Parameter\ID
  • Parameter\Name
  • Value\Is Discrete
  • Value\Operational Rate Max
  • Value\Physical Range Min
  • Value\Units
  • Value\Wraps

get.summary:
Returns a database group with a matching ID containing only its immediate children in a hierarchical tree 
            used to organize databases.
get.description:
Each EMS system has its own configured set of databases that are available for querying, such as flights,
            downloads and events. Databases are organized using database groups in a tree structure since EMS
            systems might expose a large number of databases. This API allows you to see one level of the tree
            structure.

parameters.name: emsSystemId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the system containing the EMS data.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description:
The unique identifier of the EMS database group whose contents to return. 
            If not specified, the contents of the root group are returned.

401.description: You do not have access to the requested resource.

404.description: A database group at the specified path could not be found

get.summary:
Returns a field group with a matching ID containing only its immediate children in a hierarchical tree used 
            to organize fields.
get.description:
Fields are organized using field groups in a tree structure since EMS systems and databases might expose 
            a large number of fields. This API allows you to see one level of the tree structure. This API returns only
            a minimal amount of information about the fields returned. To get additional details for an individual, 
            field, see the "field" resource below.

parameters.name: emsSystemId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the system containing the EMS data.

            specified, the contents of the root group are returned.

post.summary:
Queries a database for information, composing the query with information provided in the specified 
            query structure.
post.description:
The advantage of this query route over async-query is its simplicity. This route executes a query and returns the results in a single API call. Due to memory and network resource limitations, this route cannot be used to fetch large result sets. The route limits the maximum number of result rows that can be returned for a single query. If you do not specify a "top" limit to the results and the number of rows queried exceeds the maximum allowed, the partial result boolean flag included in the response will be set to true. If you need to access larger result sets, use the async-query route instead.

Queries can contain reference to one or more fields and can include more complex querying operations including: filtering, grouping, and sorting (by value). These operations are specified by the query model you provide the API.

parameters.name: emsSystemId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the system containing the EMS data.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the EMS database to query.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The information used to construct a query for which results are returned.

400.description: If the specified query structure is invalid or incorrectly configured. May also be returned if the top value specified is greater than the maximum number of rows that can be returned.

401.description: You do not have access to the requested resource.

post.summary:
Creates a query on a database using the provided query structure and returns an ID that can be used to
            fetch result data through other async-query routes.
post.description:
The advantage of the async-query routes over the basic query route is their ability to return very large result sets, split across many API calls. For queries with small result sets, you may prefer to use the basic query route, as it provides the simplicity of executing a query and returning the results in one call.

Use the GET v2/ems/{emsSystemId}/databases/{databaseId}/async-query/{queryId}/read/{start}/{end} route to read rows from the async-query result set.

Use the DELETE v2/ems/{emsSystemId}/databases/{databaseId}/async-query/{queryId} route to stop an async query.

Queries can contain reference to one or more fields and can include more complex querying operations including: filtering, grouping, and sorting (by value). These operations are specified by the query model you provide the API.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Admin.User.description: Represents a user account that can be used to access the website.

id.description: The unique integer identifier of the user.

username.description:
The Active Directory username of the user, typically in the form of "domain\user.name". If not in an 
            environment with multiple domains, the domain name is not needed.

lockoutPolicyEnabled.description:
Indicates whether the account lockout policy applies to this user, causing them to be locked out of the
            application for a configured amount of time after failed login attempts.

roles.description:
The list of roles to which the user is a member. Only values "Admin", "Developer", "DashboardEditor", and
            "DashboardViewer" are supported.

tableauUsername.description:
The Tableau username to which this user is linked. This user name is only needed if different than the user 
            name.

lastLogin.description: A read-only value indicating the last time the user logged into the application.

lockoutEndDateUtc.description:
A read-only value indicating the time that the user will no longer be locked out. Null if the user is not 
            currently locked out.

accessFailedCount.description: A read-only value indicating the number of times the user failed to login.

A list of messages indicating the status of the import and any extra information that may be useful to 
            convey to a user performing an import.

hasWarnings.description: A value indicating whether any of the messages included in this instance is a warning.

message.description: A string message describing an event that occurred in an API action or event.

The identifier for the analytic.

analytics.description: An in-order listing of the analytics contained in the specified group.

id.description: The identifier of the group.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Analytic.Query.description: Represents the options used to make up an analytic query.

select.description:
An array specifying the analytics to select and return in query results. Use null or an empty array to
            return only offset values

start.description:
The optional start offset in the data, in seconds from the start of the data. If not specified, the 
            beginning of the available data is used

end.description:
The optional end offset in the data, in seconds from the start of the data. If not specified, the 
            end of the available data is used

offsets.description:
The optional set of offsets to return in query results. Use as an alternative to specifying a range of 
            values using start and end

size.description: The optional limit that specifies the total number of offsets and values to return in query results

unsampledDataMode.description: This determines how to treat data values for offsets that are not sampled. If left unset this defaults to 'leaveBlank'.

unsampledValue.description: This optional parameter replaces any unsampled (blank) values with a constant value. This defaults to a null value.

doesNotExistValue.description: This optional parameter replaces any values that come back as DNE (does not exist) with a constant value. This defaults to "DNE".

offsetType.description: This defines the way in which the offsets are determined. This is required if Offsets or Size has not been set.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Analytic.Analyt.description: Represents an individual analytic that can be selected in a query.

analyticId.description: The unique string identifier of the analytic to select in a query

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Analytic.Offset.description: Class for determining which offsets to sample an analytic at.

type.description: Determines the way to retrieve samples for an analytic query.

samplingRate.description: Offsets are calculated using this sampling rate when using 'FixedRate' sampling type.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Analytic.QueryR.description: Represents the time-series data result of an analytic query.

offsets.description: An array of query result offsets, each representing seconds from the start of the data

results.description:
An array of analytic result values for each of the analytics selected in the query containing values for
            each offset

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Analytic.Analyt.description:
Represents the results of a query of an individual analytic, housing the values for the offsets contained
            in the related query result.

analyticId.description: The unique string identifier of the analytic queried

values.description: The array of analytic values corresponding to offsets specified in the query result

error.description:
Any error that may have occurred when retrieving or attempting to retrieve the values for the analytic.
            This field is only available if there is an error.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Metadata.description: Encapsulates metadata information for a parameter or analytic in EMS.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.MetadataItem.description: Encapsulates a single piece of metadata.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Asset.Fleet.description:
Represents a 'Fleet' in the EMS system.
            A fleet in this sense is a group of aircraft using the same configuration.
            There may be several fleets representing a particular model of aircraft, each showing a specific configuration
            of the airframe.

id.description: The identifier of the fleet within the system.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Asset.Aircraft.description: An aircraft in the system refers to an airframe with a particular tail number.

id.description: The identifier of the aircraft within the system.

fleetIds.description:
Each aircraft can be mapped to 0-N fleets in the system. 
            Because a fleet represents a configuration for a airframe and those configurations can change over time,
            it stands to reason that each aircraft can be mapped to more than one of them.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Asset.FlightPhase.description:
A flight phase is a coarse division of a flight into sections, such as takeoff, climb and enroute.
            The flight phases are used as inputs into some analytics.

id.description: The identifier of the flight phase within the system.

description.description: The description for this phase of flight.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Asset.Airport.description: Encapsulates the definition of an airport.

id.description: The identifier of the airport within the system.

codeIcao.description: The ICAO code associated with this airport.

codeFaa.description: The FAA / Regional code associated with this airport.

codePreferred.description: The preferred code to use for display. This is typically either the ICAO or FAA code, but can be overridden by the user.

elevation.description: The elevation of the airport, in feet.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.DatabaseGr.description: Represents a folder in the database tree of an EMS installation.

id.description: The unique string identifier for the database group

name.description: The display name for the database group

groups.description: An ordered listing of child database groups contained in this group

databases.description: An ordered listing of child databases contained in this group

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.Database.description: Represents a database type exposed by an EMS installation.

id.description: The unique string identifier for the database

pluralName.description: A plural display name for the database

singularName.description: A singular display name for the database

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.FieldGroup.description: Represents a folder in the data source tree of an EMS installation.

id.description: The unique string identifier for the field group

name.description: The display name for the field group

groups.description: An ordered list of child groups contained in a field group

fields.description: An ordered list of child fields contained in a field group

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.Field.description: Represents an individual field that can be accessed within a data source.

id.description: The unique string identifier for the field

type.description: The data type of the underlying data stored for the field

name.description: The display name for the field

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.Query.description: Represents the options used to make up a data source query.

select.description: An array specifying the fields to select and return as columns in the query results

groupBy.description:
An array specifying the fields by which to group aggregate operations. If not specified, no grouping
            is performed

orderBy.description:
An array specifying the selected columns by which to order result rows. Results are always ordered by the
            results value, not by the display formatted value (configured to be returned by the format property). If
            not specified, results are returned in default database ordering

filter.description: A filter used to narrow the query results

format.description:
Value formatting that should be performed on results values before returning. If not specified, no results
            formatting is performed. This can be overriden by specifying a value for the Format property of a SelectColumn

distinct.description: Whether to remove duplicate rows from query results before formatting the results. Using a format value other than 'none' can reduce results precision, leading to cases where two distinct rows appear equivalent after formatting is applied. Defaults to false if not specified

top.description:
Identifies a subset of rows to return.
            The subset is formed by selecting only the first N rows of the set, where N is a positive integer provided 
            as the value of this property. If not specified, all rows are returned

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.SelectColu.description: Represents a column of data that can be selected in a data source query.

fieldId.description: The unique string identifier of the field to select in a query

aggregate.description:
An optional aggregate operation to perform on the column. Omission of this property results in no aggregate 
            operation being performed

format.description:
Value formatting that should be performed on this field's value before returning.
            This will override the query's display value

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.GroupByCol.description: Represents a column of data that can be used in a group-by clause of a data source query.

fieldId.description: The unique string identifier of the field to use in a group-by clause of a query

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.OrderByCol.description: Represents a column of data that can be used in a order-by clause of a data source query.

fieldId.description: The unique string identifier of the field to use in a order-by clause of a query

aggregate.description:
An optional aggregate operation to perform on the column. Omission of this property results in no aggregate 
            operation being used in the ordering

order.description: The ordering behavior to use for the column values. The omission of this property results in ascending order

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.Filter.description: Represents the operations and arguments that can be used to filter a data source query.

operator.description: The unique string identifier of the operation to perform

args.description:
An ordered list of arguments to provide the operator. The requirements for the arguments depend on which 
            operation is being performed

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.FilterArgu.description: Represents an argument in a filter.

type.description: The type of the filter argument, describing the role of the argument.

value.description: The value represented by the filter argument.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.QueryResul.description: Represents the tabular results of a data source query.

header.description:
An ordered list of header column information, describing the fields included in the results and matching 
            the order of columns in the resulting data rows

rows.description:
An array of arrays representing the resulting data rows of a query. Each inner array represents a single 
            results row

isPartialResult.description:
Indicates whether the rows returned are a partial query result because the maximum amount of rows that can 
            be returned has been reached.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.QueryResul.description: Represents a header column in data source query result.

id.description: The unique string identifier of the field associated with this column

name.description: The user-friendly display name of the field associated with this column

units.description: The units of values of the field associated with this column. This value may be empty if not applicable

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.AsyncQuery.description:
Passed back to the client when an async query is started. This contains query header
            information, and a unique ID, with which the user can later read data for this query.

id.description: The ID of the query; this will be used when making subsequent calls to the query APIs.

inactivityTimeout.description: The number of seconds of inactivity after which an async query is eligible for automatic deletion.

header.description:
An ordered list of header column information, describing the fields included in the results and matching 
            the order of columns in the resulting data rows.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Schema.AsyncQuery.description: Represents the tabular results of a data source query obtained from an async query.

rows.description: An array of JSON string arrays, where each entry is a row in the results set

hasMoreRows.description: Whether the query has one or more rows in its result set at an index greater than the last row returned

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.EmsProfile.Profil.description: Encapsulates all the profile results for a flight.

profileVersion.description:
The numeric version of the profile that was processed to generate the results. This
            corresponds to an index in the array of version history entries for the profile

parameterFiltering.description: Whether automatic parameter filtering was enabled when the profile was processed

events.description: The events detected in the flight

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.EmsProfile.Profil.description: Encapsulates information about a profile results value (measurement or timepoint).

itemId.description: The id of the item in the profile.

dataValue.description: The computed data value for the given item

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.EmsProfile.Profil.description: Encapsulates information about an event result stored in the database.

recordNumber.description: The unique id of the event in the database

eventType.description: The unique id of the event definition that generated this event

phaseOfFlight.description: The phase of flight where the event occurred (a value from the EMS POF list)

severity.description: The event severity (a value from the EMS Severity list)

status.description:
The status of the event (a value from the EMS Status list). Typically this is defaulted to
            0 for new events, but in some data-merge scenarios we need to import a non-default value
            from a remote system

falsePositive.description:
The false positive value for the event (a value from the EMS False Positive list).
            Typically this is defaulted to 0 for new events, but in some data-merge scenarios we
            need to import a non-default value from a remote system

startTime.description: The starting offset for the event

endTime.description: The ending offset for the event

globalMeasurements.description: The global event measurements (defined for all events)

globalTimepoints.description: The global event timepoints (defined for all events)

localMeasurements.description: The event-specific measurements (different for each event type)

localTimepoints.description: The event-specific timepoints (different for each event type)

comments.description:
The event comments. Usually this is empty, but it's required for some data-merge
            scenarios.

user.description: The user that wrote the comment

date.description: The date and time that the comment was added (UTC)

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.EmsProfile.EmsPro.description: Represents an APM (Automated Parameter Measurement) profile in an EMS system.

profileId.description: The local identifier for a profile

profileGuid.description: The unique identifier of a profile in the system

library.description: Flag for if a profile is a library profile

glossaryVersion.description: The version of the EMS glossary the results were generated from.

profileId.description: The local identifier of the profile

profileGuid.description: The unique GUID of the profile in the system

currentVersion.description: The version of the associated profile

currentVersionGuid.description: The GUID identifier for the version of this profile.

glossaryItems.description: Array of entries in this glossary.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.EmsProfile.Glossa.description: Represents a single entry for an item in a profile glossary.

recordType.description: A character representing a profile glossary entries record type.

scope.description: A character representing the scope of this entry.

itemId.description: A unique integer id for this item.

eventTypeId.description: The event type id of this item. This is only available for valid event types.

dataType.description: A character representing the data type of this entry.

logicalId.description: A GUID defining this item's logical id.

name.description: The name provided for this item.

units.description: An optional unit provided for this item.

firstAssociatedItemType.description: The item type of the first associated item.

firstAssociatedItemScope.description: The scope of the first associated item.

firstAssociatedItemId.description: The item id of the first associated item.

secondAssociatedItemType.description: The item type of the second associated item.

secondAssociatedItemScope.description: The scope of the second associated item.

secondAssociatedItemId.description: The item id of the second associated item.

groupId.description: The id of the group. This should be a relative path.

groups.description: An array of groups contained by this group.

sets.description: An array of parameter sets contained by this group.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.ParameterSet.Para.description: Encapsulates the some data defining a ParameterSet.

description.description: An optional description of the ParameterSet.

items.description: An array of the parameters contained in the ParameterSet.

chartIndex.description: The index of the chart that this analytic info belongs to, or null if no index specified.

parameter.description: The analytic that is represented by this parameter set item.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Profile.ProfileRe.description: Encapsulates all the profile results for a flight.

profileVersion.description:
The integer version of the profile that was processed to generate the results,
            corresponding to an index in the array of version history entries for the profile

parameterFiltering.description: Indicates whether automatic parameter filtering was enabled when the profile was processed

events.description: The event results detected in the flight

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Profile.ProfileRe.description: Encapsulates information about a profile results value (measurement or timepoint).

itemId.description: The integer ID of the result value in the profile

dataValue.description: The computed data value for the result

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Profile.ProfileRe.description: Encapsulates information about an event result stored in the database.

recordNumber.description: The unique integer ID of the event in the database

eventType.description: The unique ID of the event definition that generated the event

phaseOfFlight.description: The phase of flight where the event occurred (which is a value from the EMS phase of flight list)

severity.description: The event severity (which is a value from the EMS severity list)

status.description:
The status of the event (which is a value from the EMS status list). Typically this defaults to
            0 for new events, but in some data-merge scenarios we need to import a non-default value
            from a remote system

falsePositive.description:
The false positive value for the event (a value from the EMS false positive list).
            Typically this defaults to 0 for new events, but in some data-merge scenarios we
            need to import a non-default value from a remote system

startTime.description: The start offset for the event

endTime.description: The end offset for the event

globalMeasurements.description: The global event measurement results (defined for all events)

globalTimepoints.description: The global event timepoint results (defined for all events)

localMeasurements.description: The event-specific measurement results (different for each event type)

localTimepoints.description: The event-specific timepoint results (different for each event type)

comments.description:
The event comments. Usually this is empty, but it's required for some data-merge
            scenarios.

user.description: The user associated with the comment

date.description: The date and time the comment was added (UTC)

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Profile.ProfileGr.description: Represents a folder in the profile tree of an EMS installation.

id.description: The globally unique ID for the profile group

name.description: The display name of the profile group

description.description: The optional description that briefly describes the profile group

groups.description: An ordered listing of child profile groups contained in this group

profiles.description: An ordered listing of child profiles contained in this group

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Profile.Profile.description: Represents an APM (Automated Parameter Measurement) profile in an EMS system.

localId.description: The local integer identifier for the profile

id.description: The globally unique identifier of the profile

name.description: The display name of the profile

library.description: Indicates whether the profile is a "library" profile

currentVersion.description: The current integer version of the profile

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Profile.ProfileGl.description: A glossary for a specific profile. This describes the type of items found in a profile.

glossaryVersion.description: The integer version of the glossary

profileLocalId.description: The local integer identifier of the associated profile

profileId.description: The globally unique identifier of the associated profile

currentVersion.description: The integer version of the associated profile

currentVersionGuid.description: The globally unique identifier for the version of the associated profile

glossaryItems.description: A list of all entries contained in the glossary

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Profile.GlossaryI.description: Represents a single entry for an item in a profile glossary.

recordType.description: A value representing a profile glossary entries record type

scope.description: A value representing the scope of the item

itemId.description: A unique integer ID for the item

eventTypeId.description: The event type ID of the item - this is only available for valid event types

dataType.description: A value representing the data type of the entry

logicalId.description: A unique ID defining the item's logical ID

name.description: The display name of the item

units.description: An optional unit describing how the type of data represented by the item

firstAssociatedItemType.description: The item type of the first associated item

firstAssociatedItemScope.description: The scope of the first associated item

firstAssociatedItemId.description: The item id of the first associated item

secondAssociatedItemType.description: The item type of the second associated item

secondAssociatedItemScope.description: The scope of the second associated item

secondAssociatedItemId.description: The item id of the second associated item

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Tableau.Trusted.description: Represents information that can be used to access Tableau content related to an associated Tableau server.

trustedUrl.description: The URL that can be used to start a trusted session with the Tableau server.

url.description: The root URL of the Tableau server with site.

site.description: The site that the TrustedUrl is able to access when used.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Model.Tableau.Tableau.description: Represents information about the associated Tableau server.

url.description: The root URL of the Tableau server with site.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.TrajectoryValueAr.description: Encapsulates the data returned when requesting trajectory values through the API.

values.description: The points in the generated trajectory.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.TrajectoryValue.description:
Encapsulates a data point defining the positional information [lat/long/alt] 
            for a sample and the location it occurred at, in seconds from start of file.

offset.description: The offset of the value, in seconds from start of file.

latitude.description: The latitude related to the offset at {Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.TrajectoryValue.Offset}.

longitude.description: The longitude related to the offset at {Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.TrajectoryValue.Offset}.

altitude.description: The altitude related to the offset at {Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.TrajectoryValue.Offset}.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.TrajectoryConfigu.description: Encapsulates a data point defining the userOptions config for a Google Earth export.

trajectoryId.description:
A unique identifier for this type of KML trajectory. 
            Typically this just the name of the file sans extension.

description.description: A description of what kind of trajectory this KML type generates.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Upload.UploadRequ.description: Encapsulates information that will be returned when beginning a new data ingestion transfer.

name.description:
The name of the transfer; this is not necessarily unique, and is basically just
            what the user passed to us when they initiated the transfer.

type.description:
The type of the upload; this is handler that we will use to process the uploaded data.
            The format of the data will be determined by what this upload type is.

password.description:
The password the data is encrypted with, if any. This point of the encryption possibility
            is that this may be part of a store-and-forward system that stores the data encrypted locally.
            (Thus passing it here along with the data is not particularly a security issue, but rather
            a way to avoid having to decrypt it as it transfers.)

totalSize.description:
The total size of the data to be transferred. This may be absent in the case where the upload
            is being streamed and the total size is unknown.

metadata.description:
Arbitrary metadata attached to the transfer record. This may be used by post-processing later
            or for other uses.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Upload.UploadPara.description:
Passed back to the client when a multi-part upload is started. This contains further
            instructions on how to proceed with the upload, including the transfer ID to pass to
            future calls, as well as any change of URL for the actual chunk uploads.

transferId.description: The ID of the transfer; this will be used when making subsequent calls to the upload APIs.

url.description:
The URL for the transfer; data block transfers regarding this upload should go to this URL.
            This may also be an empty string, in which case you should keep using the normal URLs.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Upload.UploadResu.description: Summarizes the result of an upload operation.

transferSuccessful.description:
If this is true, the transfer was successful and also the transferred data are intact.
            This includes things like verifying the integrity of zip archives, for the overall transfer
            completion.

message.description:
If there was an error, then the error message will describe it. In the case of success, there
            may also be a message here. This message will be suitable for display to a user.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Upload.UploadStat.description: This is sent as a response to an upload transfer status request.

currentCount.description: The current number of bytes the server has received on this transfer.

message.description: Contains a user-readable message about the status of the transfer.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Upload.UploadReco.description: Represents one record in the list of uploads that we know about on the server side.

id.description: The transfer ID of the transfer, set by the server when the transfer started.

name.description: Name field set by the client when the transfer started.

currentCount.description: The current number of bytes transferred.

totalSize.description: The total size of the transfer, if known.

lastTransfer.description:
The timestamp of the last time someone uploaded bytes to this transfer. This will
            be used to determine when a transfer can be aborted automatically.

lastProcessing.description:
The timestamp of the last time someone tried to process this transfer. This will
            be used to determine when a transfer can be aborted automatically.

startTime.description: The start time of the transfer, from when the initial start request is made.

transferFinishTime.description: The finish time of the actual data transfer portion of the process.

processingFinishTime.description: The finish time of the processing portion of the process.

state.description: The state of the upload, up to and including EMS hand-off.

metadata.description:
Metadata for the upload; this is somewhat arbitrary and specific to the type
            of the transfer, but in any event, it will be a JSON blob with key/value pairs.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Upload.UploadProc.description: Represents the status of an upload processing through EMS.

downloadRecord.description: The upload's download record, if known.

downloadState.description:
A description of the download record's processing state. This should be checked before assuming
            that the download is correct and complete.

flights.description: The upload's flight information, if known.

errorMessage.description: Any error message associated with the processing of the upload, if any.

Adi.Ems.Web.Api.V2.Dto.Upload.UploadProc.description: A single flight result within a larger download result.

flightRecord.description: The flight record for the flight.

flightStatus.description:
A description of the flight record's processing state. This should be checked before assuming
            that the flight is correct and complete.
